New Records: Aaron Jones scored 94 off 40 balls with 10 sixes, the most sixes hit in an innings in the men's T20 World Cup by a player other than Chris Gayle
Key Match Events: Aaron Jones and Andries Gous made a 131-run partnership at a run rate of 14.29
Canada's seamers got the ball to swing and seam under lights, but Jones got stuck into the spinners
Gous caught fire too when he lined up Jeremy Gordon for 6, 4, 6, 4 in the 14th over, which cost Canada 33 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Jones was asked to describe USA's style of cricket, and he said: 'To be honest I'll say fearless cricket, positive cricket, smart cricket. I think that's what we're really and truly trying to do. We don't want to regret anything. We want to leave everything out there on the park.'
Post-Match Reflections: USA announced their arrival in the T20 World Cup with a demolition of their rivals Canada in Dallas
Jones and Gous handed USA their fifth successive win over Canada, having beaten them 4-0 in the lead-up to their first-ever World Cup appearance
Miscellaneous Highlights: Corey Anderson became the fifth player to represent two different teams at the T20 World Cup
Anderson marked the occasion with a clever spell full of cutters into the Dallas pitch
USA got the job done with seven wickets and 14 balls to spare
